file_content.text: Greetings again, Master Jedi.
I imagine the blast will be quite impressive from here, for an instant.
Ah. Greetings, Master Jedi. All parameters are met, my work can finally be demonstrated.
Is your commanding officer hiding somewhere?
Where's the captain?
Following standard procedure, all personnel above the rank of lieutenant have been evacuated.
I sense trouble.
Explain yourself, droid.
Obeying my standing orders, I have seeded this vessel with detonite charges.
These charges are sufficient to destroy the Javelin, its occupants and nearby vessels. I apologize for any inconvenience caused.
These reinforcements were bait; the Empire wanted our alliance dead.
We walked into a trap.
Allow me to outline the genius of my work.
That explosion could wipe out all our ships, and the Esh-kha.
Our fleet will be lost!
Oh, don't worry, Master Jedi. You'll be dead before then.
Disable those charges or I'll break you down to your components.
Disarm the bombs, immediately.
All interfering remote "safeties" have been removed.
I placed multiple detonite charges in mathematically precise positions. There was no response when I warned other Imperial vessels, I assume they know of the countdown.
I have placed multiple detonite charges in mathematically precise positions. All Imperial vessels have been signaled to withdraw, as the countdown has begun.
Is snare Empire laid for us. Is bad death, to fall because of trick!
Then the entire purpose of sending this dreadnaught was to set a trap.
The Empire's willing to sacrifice a whole dreadnaught, just to trap us? I should feel flattered.
Empire's so sharp it cuts itself. And we fell for it.
So we walked right into a trap?
By my calculations, even if dozens of the charges are disarmed, it is now impossible to prevent the Javelin's destruction.
But if we disable as many as we can, there won't be enough of a blast to destroy our ships.
We can still save our fleet.
You may attempt it, but my placement of the charges is flawless.
Don't you care that the explosion will annihilate you?
But you'll be destroyed too.
I can still take satisfaction in a job well done.
I'm going to enjoy proving you wrong. Now tell me where to find those charges.
Don't count on it.
There are charges on all main coolant regulation systems, to ensure complete destruction.
Will send warning to all on board.
Holiday, tell the others about those bombs before our friend here gets another bright idea.
I'll alert the others. We'll need everybody to get those bombs disarmed.
I'll pass on the good news to everyone. And the bomb positions.
I'll send the bomb locations out to everybody!
You and I can take care of the charges nearby, and trust the others to reach the rest in time.
We'll get the closest bombs.
Do it. If we work together, we can handle the charges nearby and then run for the ship.
There's no time to waste.
We can reach the closest charges in time, but if the entire Javelin is rigged, we may not be able to save it.
This ship may be lost.
Give me the location of the closest bombs, and tell my friends where to find the rest. That's an order.
If this is how you wish to spend your final minutes, Master Jedi, I have no direct orders prohibiting it.
A shame my accomplishment will soon be superheated vapor, but such is the nature of demolition work. Good day.
